name: Sorry Excuse 'Listen With Prejudice' 7" (mixed recycled vinyl)
description:
Raging out of Kansas City, Missouri SORRY EXCUSE play scathing hardcore that focuses more on unrelenting speed than on breakdowns. I've seen them compared to THE REPOS and I've compared them to COKE BUST, but both comparisons fail to capture the SORRY EXCUSE experience. Eight songs.

1st press: Large hole, hand stamped 'X' and 'XX' on blank white labels. 300 copies. 
2nd press: Small hole, mixed vinyl. Jade, Pink, and White Marble. 300 copies.

Track Listing:

MWP
Roadkill
A Million Bucks
Divide
Eyes Wide Shut
Mounting Stress
Eye for an Eye
Grow Up

name: Poison Planet 'Boycott Everything' 12" EP (w/poster & B side screen print)
description:
Originally pressed as a 7" on Refuse Records out of Europe for Poison Planet's European tour in June 2011, the US version has been a year long project. The band felt that the 7" format lacked the visual impact that they intended and the lyrics and art had been rushed. The US version is a one sided 12" EP, with a screen printed "B" side. The front and back cover art have been updated and the lyric sheet has expanded from a small jam packed insert that was just columns of white text on a black background to include relevant imagery and additional essays. Lastly, to add to the final package they've included a 24"x36" black and white poster. 

Comparisons are consistently made to early 80's Boston hardcore, early Corrosion of Conformity, The Repos, and with this release an emerging element of Dead Kennedys influence. 

1st press of 500. Black vinyl with B side screen print. ThirdxParty/NotNormal.

All mailorders will come with additional Poison Planet stickers and promo poster.

Track listing:

Liquor Flesh Trade
Boycott Everything
I Hope You Choke
Border Fences
Tidal Leveling

name: Coke Bust - Fuck Bar Culture 7" EP (mixed recycled vinyl)
description:
Hyper fast hardcore that captures the catchy repeated choruses and intense breaks of youth crew with the ferocity of brutal hardcore bands like Infest building on the foundation of other 2000's bands like What Happens Next? and Life's Halt. They aren't afraid to tell it like it is and take a punch in the face for doing so (but they're so good natured everyone will be friends after.) Still, Fuck Bar Culture. Pink vinyl.

Track Listing:
Fumigation
A Lot to Digest
Figured Out
Fuck Bar Culture
Privileged
Because of the Label

name: Poison Planet 'Undermine' 7"
description:
Five dissonant tirades of personal and political resistance inspired as much by Howard Zinn and Naomi Klein as they are by The Repos, Positive Reinforcement, Discharge, and DYS. This is hardcore punk meant to communicate ideas, not just be the soundtrack for your latest dance moves. Comes in a glued pocket sleeve with a 7"x11" lyric/explanation sheet.

Track Listing:
Undermine
Mired
Nothing Gets Done
Soundtrack of Resistance
No Pain, No Gain (DYS)

The 1st press of 300 copies was on recycled colored vinyl. 
The 2nd press of 300 copies is on recycled colored vinyl.

name: Poison Planet 'Oblivious' 7" EP
description:
Abrasive and uncompromising XVX hardcore punk from Chicago. Elements of bands like Youth of Today, Discharge, 86 Mentality, and The Repos fused together to create a pummeling combination. Members of this line-up went on to be in Noose and Manipulation. This 3rd pressing comes with full lyrics, explanations, and guitar tabs. 300 more copies on recycled black vinyl.

Track Listing 
Eyes Wide Open 
Faded Ideals

Bible Stories 
Menace 
Oblivious

1st press was 100 copies recycled colored vinyl. 
2nd press was 300 copies recycled colored vinyl. (200 small hole/100 large hole due to an error at the pressing plant) 
3rd press is 300 copies on recycled black vinyl.
